episodeTitle: Robin Betrayed! The Motive of the World Government!
episodeTitleJapanese: 裏切られたロビン！世界政府の思惑！
episodeTitleRomanized: Uragirareta Robin! Sekai Seifu no Omowaku!
description: Robin is shocked to learn that CP9 plans to execute the Straw Hats for violating their agreement by coming to Enies Lobby. Spandam beats Robin when she questions his Buster Call authority, triggering a brief flashback to the Ohara incident. Meanwhile, Chopper translates Sodom and Gomorrah's backstory, and Luffy fights through Marines before encountering Blueno at the courthouse.

events.title: CP9 Reveals Plan to Execute Straw Hats
events.description: Rob Lucci reveals that CP9 plans to kill the Straw Hat Pirates because they violated the original agreement. The deal was that Robin's surrender would allow the crew to leave Water 7 safely, but their arrival at Enies Lobby breached those terms.
events.significance: Establishes that the Straw Hats are now marked for death by CP9, raising the stakes of the conflict and showing that Robin's sacrifice was in vain.

quotes.text: The terms of the arrangement were that, excluding Nico Robin, the Straw Hat Pirates would be allowed to leave Water 7 safely. After allowing the Straw Hats to leave Water 7 safely as promised, they then decided to come to Enies Lobby, which was beyond the scope of the arrangement.
quotes.speaker: Rob Lucci
quotes.context: Explaining the loophole in the agreement to Robin

events.title: Rob Lucci Reveals His Bloodlust
events.description: When Spandam asks what CP9 wants, Rob Lucci reveals his true motivation: government-sanctioned killing. He states that as long as he remains part of the establishment, he can kill criminals, innocents, and whoever gets in the way with impunity.
events.significance: Establishes Rob Lucci as the most dangerous and psychopathic member of CP9, revealing his true nature beyond simply following orders.

quotes.text: Our Justice exists in the World Government. We want blood, and we have the right to kill people because we are with the Government.
quotes.speaker: Rob Lucci
quotes.context: Revealing his true motivation to Spandam

events.title: Spandam Beats Robin
events.description: Robin questions why Spandam was given rights to the Buster Call, which triggers his anger. Spandam violently beats Robin in response to her questioning his authority.
events.significance: Demonstrates Spandam's cruelty and insecurity, while also triggering Robin's traumatic memories of the Ohara incident and the Buster Call.

events.title: Brief Ohara Flashback
events.description: When Robin is reminded of the Buster Call, she has a brief flashback to the Ohara incident, showing the archaeologists discussing their theories about the Lost Century and the Ancient Kingdom.
events.significance: Foreshadows the full Ohara flashback that will come later in the arc, and reinforces Robin's trauma related to the Buster Call.

events.title: Sodom and Gomorrah's Origin Story
events.description: Chopper translates for Sodom and Gomorrah, revealing how the King Bulls met the Franky Family. They were saved from the stomach of a Sea King by Franky, and in gratitude, they swore loyalty to him forever.
events.significance: Provides character development for the King Bulls and demonstrates Chopper's ability to communicate with animals, while also showing the bonds that tie the Franky Family together.

events.title: Sogeking Goes Missing
events.description: Chopper and the Franky Family realize that Sogeking (Usopp) is not with them anymore. He has separated from the group to pursue his own objective.
events.significance: Sets up Sogeking's independent actions during the Enies Lobby assault, which will be crucial to rescuing Robin.

events.title: Luffy Fights Through Marines
events.description: Luffy battles his way through waves of Marines at Enies Lobby, fighting on rooftops to avoid being surrounded. He demonstrates improved combat abilities compared to his earlier encounters.
events.significance: Shows Luffy's determination to reach Robin and his growth as a fighter, setting up his confrontation with Blueno.

events.title: Blueno Confronts Luffy at the Courthouse
events.description: Blueno appears before Luffy on the roof of the Courthouse of Justice, having waited for the invaders. He creates an air door and explains this is the first time anyone has gotten past the entrance.
events.significance: Sets up the rematch between Luffy and Blueno, where Luffy will demonstrate his new Gear Second technique. This is a crucial test of Luffy's growth since their first encounter.

quotes.text: You made it this far. This is the first time anyone has gotten past the entrance.
quotes.speaker: Blueno

events.title: Blueno Demonstrates Door-Door Fruit
events.description: Blueno demonstrates his Doa Doa no Mi (Door-Door Fruit) powers by creating doors in the air, showing Luffy the abilities he will face in their upcoming battle.
events.significance: Reminds viewers of Blueno's Devil Fruit powers and sets up the challenge Luffy must overcome in the next episode.

quotes.text: The terms of the arrangement were that, excluding Nico Robin, the Straw Hat Pirates would be allowed to leave Water 7 safely.
quotes.speaker: Rob Lucci
quotes.context: Explaining the loophole in the deal with Robin

quotes.text: Our Justice exists in the World Government. We want blood, and we have the right to kill people because we are with the Government.
quotes.speaker: Rob Lucci
quotes.context: Revealing his true bloodthirsty nature to Spandam

themes.description: Robin learns that her sacrifice to save the Straw Hats was meaningless, as CP9 plans to kill them anyway due to a technicality in their agreement.
themes.symbolism: The broken agreement represents the World Government's duplicity and willingness to manipulate the truth to achieve their ends.

themes.description: Rob Lucci's revelation that he seeks government-sanctioned killing exposes the darkness within the World Government's justice system.
themes.symbolism: CP9 represents the corrupted side of justice, where power is used for personal satisfaction rather than righteous purposes.

themes.description: The brief Ohara flashback shows how Robin's past trauma continues to haunt her, especially when faced with the Buster Call again.
themes.symbolism: The Buster Call represents the ultimate destructive power of the World Government and Robin's deepest fears.

characterSpotlights.development: Robin realizes her sacrifice was meaningless and faces both physical abuse and psychological torment through memories of Ohara.
keyActions: Questions Spandam about Buster Call authority

characterSpotlights.development: Lucci reveals his true psychopathic nature, showing he's motivated by bloodlust rather than duty.
keyActions: Reveals loophole in agreement with Robin
Explains his desire for government-sanctioned killing
Disturbs even Spandam with his honesty
quotes: Our Justice exists in the World Government. We want blood, and we have the right to kill people because we are with the Government.

characterSpotlights.development: Luffy fights through Marines with improved abilities, showing his growth since facing CP9 in Water 7.

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime expands on the Marine battle sequences as Luffy fights his way to the courthouse, adding more action scenes than present in the manga.

trivia.fact: Episodes 268 and 269 aired together as a television special on June 25, 2006.
This episode had a TV rating of 10.2% and ranked 4th in viewership for its timeslot.
Adventure World by Delicatessen was the last ending theme used in One Piece for 17 years until 2023, when the series added a new ending theme.
This episode adapts portions of manga chapters 382 and 383.
